page.title: 04Inverkeithing Lammas Fair
page.content:
The oldest type of entertainment in Inverkeithing is the{Lammas Fair.}As far back as{1640,}and probably long before, five fairs were held in the Burgh. These fairs were attended by vendors of all kinds of goods, and of livestock, and they were also places of entertainment. The burgh records of 1652 says that the fair was a day for "fun, frolic, fit races, ale, and drunken folks, and gentel and simple. Folks came from near and far to see it." Formerly held on the 1st August, it is now held on the first Thursday of August and the following two days.
Nowadays, the Lammas Fair is a time of great celebration, with{fairground {rides in the High Street,}but there are not so many stalls.
